Job Summary:

Show Programmers facilitate development of animation for Audio-Animatronics figures, animated props, or ride systems by programming intricately controlled themed attraction sequences, and/or integrate show control systems with rides, Audio-Animatronics, and other show elements such as special effects, audio/video, show lighting, etc. These highly technical positions require strong creative intuition and the ability to collaborate closely with Creative, Engineering, Ride, Manufacturing, Media Production, and Theme Park Maintenance teams.

A Show Programmer’s work can fall into one, or more, of four distinct categories:
  • Audio-Animatronics Figure Animation
    Developing character animations for Audio-Animatronics figures and animated props.
  • Ride Animation
    Developing animations for free-ranging vehicles, motion base platforms, and other programmable ride systems.
  • Figure Programming
    Developing digital Audio-Animatronics animation rigs and configuring Audio-Animatronics figures and Show Action Equipment for safe operation.
  • Show Sequence Programming
    Integrating Show Control systems with rides, Audio-Animatronics, and other show elements such as special effects, audio/video, projection, show lighting, etc.

A successful Show Programming candidate must demonstrate exceptional skills in one or more of the fore mentioned areas.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee a figure show programming team through all phases of engineering design, production, installation, testing, and documentation while partnering with the show animators and creative team to ensure the optimal creative performance and safety requirements of the Audio-Animatronics figures.
  • Developing digital Audio-Animatronics animation rigs and configuring Audio-Animatronics figures and Show Action Equipment for safe operation.
  • Assist in creating, debugging, and organizing Audio-Animatronics digital assets (character sheets, animation data, rigs, ride paths, shots, and/or models).
  • Integrating Show Control systems with rides, Audio-Animatronics figures, and other show elements such as special effects, audio/video, projection, show lighting, etc.
  • Pipeline and animation process support and asset integration.
  • Figure Programming process development support and ideation.
  • Partner with Engineering and Creative teams to configure and program Audio-Animatronics figures and Show Action Equipment to conform to safety requirements and to meet creative intent.
  • Document and archive all attraction show data created by the Show Programming department.
  • Tool development and maintenance.
  • Lead and mentor less experienced show programmers with the tools and skillset to grow within the department.
  • Support show programming management in future casting and tool sets used across multiple projects
Develop processes and pipeline with partnering groups to be used across projects.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Familiar with maintaining and creating rigs for CG character animation.
  • Able to provide technical support for computer graphic animation applications.
  • Desired software knowledge/familiarity among: Maya and/or Motion Builder, Adobe Creative Suite, and Shotgun
  • Desired scripting knowledge with languages such as: Python, Mel, C, C++
  • Able to communicate (verbally and in writing) clearly and concisely, regularly keeping stakeholders informed of status, risks, and issues.
  • Able to function in a dynamic work environment, managing multiple project activities.
  • Able to work with limited supervision and to integrate inputs from many individual team members.
  • Have a high tolerance for change and changing requirements.
  • Be a creative problem solver and demonstrate comfort with inventive solutions.
  • Have a valid passport and willing to travel domestically or internationally.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Have basic knowledge of mechanical systems, control systems, and/or robotics.
  • Experience with Kuka robotics.
  • Desired knowledge of Tait Navigator software.
  • Experience with motion-capture tools and processes.
  • Familiarity with Unreal Engine and/or Unity, Z-Brush and Solidworks.

Required Education

  • Two-year Electronics Degree or, BA or BFA in Traditional Animation, Computer Animation, Game Development or, BS in automation control systems programming, or equivalents.
OR
  • Demonstrate multiple years of on-the-job experience and training in real-world industrial automation, or animation roles, as indicated above.

Job Summary:

The Interior Design Studio is responsible for interior spaces in our theme parks, hotels and cruise lines. The scope of work encompasses conceptual design through contract documentation and field administration. Also included in the scope of work is specifications of material and furnishing.

You will report to the Manager, Interior Design

Responsibilities:

  • Provide support to multiple projects by assisting in project design development and technical documentation
  • Provide design documentation in the form of graphic illustration, imagery boards, color renderings, and research and documentation on assigned projects
  • Perform multiple technical tasks and documentation, including color & material design and documentation, basic AutoCAD support, and FF&E design and specifications
  • Support the Interior Design cost estimating process through collection of data for review
  • Provide design and analysis to support the production of design/construction/contract documents under close mentorship

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum one year of experience in an interior design practice, or one or more professional internships
  • Working knowledge and experience in the practice of interior design.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated thoughtful design, artistic skills and ability to problem solve
  • Demonstrated proficiency in digital drafting and illustration tools such as: Revit Creative Suite, Illustrator, and SketchUp

Required Education

  • A degree from an accredited interior design program

Preferred Education

  • 4 year degree from an accredited interior design program

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

description:
Job Summary:

The project coordinator leads efforts to integrate work across all Live Entertainment disciplines and ensures streamlined communication and process workflows through all project phases from creative development into design and production, and installation and delivery. The Project Coordinator is responsible for bringing different disciplines together to solve challenges and drive results. This position focuses team members on the integrated goals of the project and drives integration between internal and external project team members, vendors, and consultants. This position provides overall integration and project leadership supporting the overall project team and provides clear communication regarding deliverables and action items.

The coordinator must consistently maintain a bottom-up, broad perspective across all disciplines to ensure that all aspects of the work are covered, and no efforts are duplicated. The Project Coordinator is the center of communication and connection for a project team

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate and integrate project information with internal and external organizations including project team, creative and design studios, operations, municipalities, vendors, and contractors
  • Monitors meetings and other communications and provides updates as necessary to ensure proper integration and to resolve issues in a timely manner
  • Owns responsibility for development and documentation of scope lists, Project Strategies, deliverables matrices, etc. across all disciplines
  • With Production Manager, provides regular communication ensuring integration of personnel, project schedules, and disciplines for the Project
  • Compile, validate, and reconcile project information and project documentation in appropriate file management system (Box, Teams)
  • Facilitates team discussions (brainstorming sessions, creative development sessions, design reviews, peer review sessions etc.) to align scope with budget
  • Prepare and participate in presentations to executive management regarding project status using judgement and discretion to determine content
  • Keeps all project update tools in sync and up to date such as dashboards, online forms, and project status notes
  • Assists in the process of hiring outside vendors and the professional bid package preparation with Project Team and Sourcing and Procurement
  • Empowered to make decisions on day-to-day planning of projects; Issues and recommendations that deviate from project objectives or schedule would be reviewed with other project leaders for final resolution
  • Maintain and update project travel log, travel authorizations, travel communication and itineraries.
  • Domestic and international travel may be required

Basic Qualifications:

  • Requires a minimum of 2 years related experience - leadership experience, film/theater production, immersive experiences, or other Disney/Themed Entertainment projects (Internships will be considered)
  • Highly organized self-starter with excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to deliver under tight deadlines
  • Knowledge and a strong interest in the Live Entertainment and or/Theater, Themed Entertainment, and Immersive Experiences
  • Willingness to learn about technological trends that arise in the ever-changing Live Entertainment and Immersive Experience landscape
  • Ability to give and take direction, adapt to change, establish relationships and work in a team environment
  • Ability to work through conflict and guide team members with problem-solving
  • Excellent client relationship & interpersonal skills
  • Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel (including formulas)
  • Must be available and willing to work extended hours as occasionally needed per day or per week, including weekends and holidays, to meet business needs and/or deadlines
  • Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite products like Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator is a plus

Required Education

  • Strongly prefer a four-year undergraduate degree in Theater, Film, Design, or other Entertainment or Development-related field.
  • Consideration will be made for those with more than 2 years’ experience and/or may be working toward a degree

Job Summary:

The Walt Disney Imagineering Technology Studio Art & Media Pipeline team is looking for a Senior level developer with 8-10 years’ experience to assist with programming tasks and technical responsibilities of the group. The Technology Studio is a group of technologists working within Imagineering to create and deploy software and software/hardware integration tools to help increase the capabilities of Imagineering art and design practice.

Responsibilities:

  • Digital pipeline tools development for 3D content creation including theme-park visualizations, animated animatronic animations, ride vehicles, simulated projectors, and other dynamic show elements
  • Troubleshoot and support previously built software products and/or proof-of-concepts
  • Engage with designers and artists to better support them and gather new requirements

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 8-10 year's experience as Technical Director or similar working in VFX Pipeline and/or Video game pipeline
  • Autodesk Maya (scripting and API (C++/Python/OpenMaya API) development experience as well animation rigging experience
  • Programming proficiency in Python (with an emphasis on packaging/deployment/ custom user tools)
  • Unreal (general, asset workflow / basic blueprints)
  • Working with Windows systems
  • Communication skills (written and spoken), problem-solving, adaptability and a willingness to mentor junior developers

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Virtual Reality experience in both content development and/or systems development
  • Game engine development (game logic, plugin, core engine) experience
  • CAD software (SolidWorks, REVIT, Rhino or equivalent)
  • Shotgrid
  • UI/UX prototyping or programming experience and/or tools (PyQt, Qt, Wx, CSS)
  • Web programming (HTML5/CSS3, Javascript, jQuery, Ruby on Rails, Django)
  • Developing cross-platform software (Windows, Mac OS, Linux)
  • Strong 3D math skills and computer graphics programming experience (OpenGL/DirectX)
  • Ability to learn new APIs and SDKs quickly
  • Familiarity with USD
  • Familiarity with REZ
  • Shader programming experience (GLSL/HLSL/Cg)
  • Physics based simulation (Simulink, ANSYS)
  • Knowledge of 3D/2D content creation software (Autodesk Maya, MotionBuilder, SolidWorks, Houdini, Substance Painter, etc.)

Required Education

  • Bachelors or equivalent experience

Job Summary:

Responsible for establishing the capital budget during conceptual and monitoring the design for adherence to the budget throughout the remaining project life cycle

Responsibilities:

  • Directs staff of Senior Project Estimators, Project Estimators, and Show/Ride Estimators in providing and/or coordinating full estimating services on a portfolio of large, complex facility/show/ride projects throughout the project life cycle, conceptual through turnkey
  • Develops, reviews and approves complete conceptual through bid work, and provides final estimating input on complex projects as prepared by assigned staff
  • Provides technical support to personnel preparing project capital requests
  • Provides and/or coordinates full estimating services on a portfolio of large, complex facility/show/ride projects throughout the project life cycle, conceptual through turnkey
  • Interacts with Design, Engineering, Project Management, Construction, Manufacturing and Operations personnel (core project team) in development of estimates
  • Provides complete conceptual through bid estimates and includes final input on complex projects
  • Reviews, approves, and provides technical support to personnel and outside estimating organizations preparing discipline estimates for assigned project work
  • Responsible for estimating on all assigned projects including new Theme Parks. These complex projects involve all aspects of work including sitework, shows and rides, interior finishes, design, engineering, etc
  • Participates in estimating, negotiating and settling all change orders during the implementation;
  • Provides complete conceptual through bid estimates and includes final input on complex project
  • Interfaces with owner, A/E, and other contractors to provide engineering and cost data regarding project feasibility
  • Tracks awarded contracts as assigned – may include estimating extra work items, change orders, credits, procuring materials, etc
  • Tests estimates for reasonableness based upon comparable/equivalent historical experience
  • Develops total project Estimated Final Cost (EFC) with project team and divisions; reviews with Project Division and Senior Management for concurrence
  • Oversees development of total project EFC estimate for capital authorization. Coordinates discrete estimates/bids based on the scope/design documentation and implementation plan from Divisions, Construction Manager, outside vendors;
  • Participates in estimating, negotiating and settling all change orders during the implementation

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 8 Years estimating, cost control, and/or engineering experience (at least 4 years estimating experience) in similar facility or ride construction strongly desired
  • Minimum 3 Years supervisory experience required

Required Education

  • Four year degree in Construction Management/Engineering, Architecture or Engineering or equivalent combinations of technical training and/or related experience

description:
Job Summary:

Construction management is responsible for supervising and coordinating all on-site construction activities through installation on a project or multiple projects. Monitors safety, quality, schedules on the field, while providing technical expertise and ensuring work in place meets quality requirements of contract documents, applicable codes, and Disney standards. Coordinates and interfaces with all WDI Studios, DLR / WDW Operations and Security contractors, vendors, and governmental agencies. Construction management is the primary responsible Studio for everything that happens on WDI construction projects, including all impact to Operations.

Responsibilities:

• Project influencer • Evaluates risk early in project and provides strategic thinking expertise during pre-construction • Arbitrates on-site conflicts between contractors
• Leads commissioning activities outlined in specifications and codes
• Leads overall QA/QC program • Lead overall project logistics
• Leads communication, coordinates, and collaborates project specific priorities with WDI Project Superintendents, contractors, clients, consultants, schedulers, controllers, and project team members
• Ultimately responsible for all field activities / safety / quality
• Intervenes on any inspection issues and manages the RCID relations
• Manages the safety program in close coordination with WDI / DPEP / Worldwide Safety
• Tracks personnel on site, equipment used, and progress
• Reviews and approves progress payment requisitions
• Drives critical path, schedule, KSMs, and Milestone compliance — elevates to leaders as needed
• Facilitates contractor coordination with DPEP entities and related project WDI direct contractors and/or vendors (RCID, RCES, COA, Intertek PSI, Pest Management, Key Control/Locksmith Services, WDW / DLR warehouses, FAM, BVCC, retail, LOB's, etc.)
• Enforces Safety Emergency Response awareness
• Coordinates site security with Principal / General Superintendent, Operations, Construction Manager, and other project team members
• Establishes and maintains project photo documentation

Basic Qualifications:

• Minimum 7 years outside field experience in applicable site development (attractions, commercial, residential, retail, or resort development projects)
• Strong organization and tracking skills
• Collaboration and relationship building
• Conflict Management • Ability to lead Pull Planning & collaborate with Planner / Scheduler
• Manage multiple priorities • Justification For Change/Directive writing
• Technical experience and expertise in all areas of construction field activities
• Ability to read and interpret construction drawings and specifications
• Competent in Office and project related software for given intended project: BIM 360, Bluebeam, BOX, etc.

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, its talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects worldwide which includes other Disney Intellectual Property such as Marvel, Pixar and Lucasfilm.

Innovation is at the center of everything we do at WDI, and nothing reflects that more than our work environment. We celebrate collaborative thinking and promote cross-disciplinary partnerships to foster a culture of diversity and creativity.

Our vision is to expand the capabilities of Imagineering into new product categories and industry-leading innovations that will define the future of entertainment.

The New Experience Development Executive is a leadership role within Walt Disney Imagineering charged with expanding Disney reach and growth by developing innovative experiences for new markets and new consumer segments. This experienced executive brings equal parts creative visionary, product strategist, brand expert and process pioneer. Our mission is to invent new ways of working, exploring and inventing with creativity at the core of all we do. This leader harnesses that mission and their well-honed skills to combine our incredible wealth of stories and brand strengths into new experiential categories that span physical and virtual realms. This individual is a master relationship manager who will build and leverage a network spanning project and creative executives, business and investment partners and stakeholders across and beyond The Walt Disney Company. This leader thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast-advancing environment, where consumer and market insights, creative instinct, value creation and team building meet to take ideas from initial brainstorm to an approved proposal at the highest levels of the Company.

The New Experience Development Executive will report to the VP-Creative & Advanced Development, Disney Live Entertainment. The team will relocate to Orlando, Florida in late 2024.

Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead ideation of new experience initiatives and proof of concept ideas into scalable applications that bring Disney magic to new frontiers
  • Transform Disney storytelling and IP into experiences that target consumer desire and demand at a global scale
  • Partner with creative directors, producers and experience creators across the range of Walt Disney Imagineering development process
  • Define Disney brand quality standards and process in new partnership models
  • Develop an integrated menu plan of projects, investments and scale to forecast Company, DPEP and WDI planning of capital, growth and talent
  • Define resource, casting, talent and consultant strategies across a range of initiatives in partnership with relevant studio and department leaders
  • Actively generate and seek out content partnership potential across broader TWDC in association with Studios, Disney Television Networks, and DMED businesses (Disney+, Hulu, etc…)
  • Partner with Global Development to inform and advance new business models, schedules and deal terms, and clear articulation of WDI roles, responsibilities and commitments in contracts with outside partners
  • Challenge the status quo of process, roles and techniques to unlock innovation and speed to market of new business concepts
  • Ensure new experience concepts are feasible within cost, schedule and quality parameters defined by the business case
  • Define the Disney differentiator brand and IP elements and required specialty procurement strategies leveraging internal and external capabilities
  • Work across the WDI organization to define and approve process, including responsibilities, staffing and soft cost plans, and validated delivery methodologies to drive efficient models of product development and execution
  • Lead the upfront reporting of progress, milestones, budget and risk management for assigned New Experience initiatives
  • Oversee smooth transition of approved project(s) based on an agreed plan for WDI detailed design, delivery and execution as required
  • Highly complex with high risk, novel process and models and high degree of sensitivity
Communication/Influence and Effectiveness
  • Entrepreneurial thinker comfortable defining new ways of working along the way
  • Develop and build teams with diverse, globally-relevant experiences and mindsets
  • Develop a roster of outside industry-leading creative consultants, business partners, and cultural thought leaders to contribute to existing and new DPEP business endeavors
  • Create presentation materials that synthesize business and creative considerations for senior level DPEP leadership that enable confident review and approvals
  • Assist in setting strategies and priorities and developing deliverables for the executive review (with Chairman, CEO, DPEP Chairman & DPEP Executive Committee)
  • Partner with a wide range of stakeholders, all with responsibility for shared success

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 10 years relevant experience in leading business strategies/projects
  • Proven advanced knowledge of Disney or similarly complex brand(s) with an expert ability to translate and evolve brand into business-leading growth ideas
  • Deep knowledge of new and established trends in the travel, tourism, entertainment and leisure industries
  • A strong, confident creative sensibility balanced with strategic and business parameters of success
  • Understanding of strategic planning, business principles, forecasting and budget management at a global level
  • Experienced in leading the integration of multiple data sources into clear, actionable insights to build concrete solutions
  • Keen understanding of the creative and delivery process, in particular new product types and innovative concepts by Disney and the broader industry
  • Excellent communication skills, including verbally, written and in formal speech/presentation settings, and strong executive presence
  • Strong storytelling and communication skill; paints a compelling vision of what’s possible
  • Proven, trusted builder of relationships and partnerships at all levels of a complex, matrix and globally
  • Positive attitude and proven ability to influence partners and create an energized environment
  • Skilled manager of teams, including prioritizing work and driving high level output
  • Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and business needs
  • Ability to both think at a high level and execute at a tactical level
  • Willingness to travel domestically and internationally

Required Education

  • BS/BA in finance, business, design and/or engineering. MBA a plus

Additional Information:

This role will initially be based in Glendale, CA but will relocate to Orlando, FL in late 2024.

Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

  • Prior experience as Lead Project Planner/Scheduler.

Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering makes the impossible possible, by combining innovation and storytelling to bring Disney stories, characters and worlds to life. Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects. Disney Imagineers are uniquely talented individuals that bring together the best aspects of creativity, innovation, and passion.

At Imagineering Research and Development, our mission is to use technology to build new experiences for our Guests and new tools for Imagineers and the Cast Members who power our parks. R&D is a team of engineers, designers, artists and scientists who share a passion for solving hard problems and building ground-breaking experiences. As a mechanical design engineer, you will create new ways to design, build and animate dynamic physical characters, immersive environments and interactive experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop mechanical designs that meet functional requirements.
  • Own all phases of the design and fabrication process – early concept design, prototyping, 3D modeling, detailed design, production drawings for manufacturing, assembly and testing
  • Lead internal design reviews and reviews with external vendors and fabricators
  • Interface with Disney fabricators or external machine shops to ensure that designs can be successfully produced
  • Test and iterate on proof-of-concept designs, evolving requirements and designs as the team learns
  • Contribute to the culture and community of the WDI R&D Studio

Basic Qualifications:

  • 6+ years' experience as a mechanical design engineer
  • Strong mechanical design experience, ideally in robotics or mechatronics industry
  • Experience designing and building complex, electro-mechanical systems
  • CAD experience (preferably SolidWorks) mastery of parts/assemblies/drawings
  • Rapid prototyping experience, ability to fabricate your designs at a prototype level
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes (plating, milling, turning, EDM, grinding)
  • Embraces flexibility and adaptability as the team learns through prototyping and playtesting, adjusting strategy as needed
  • Experience managing fabrication vendors
  • Ability to work collaboratively with other technical and creative disciplines
  • Ability to provide clear direction and feedback to other team members
  • Thinks strategically and creatively to solve challenges
  • Manages & prioritizes multiple assignments in a highly dynamic R&D environment
  • Demonstrates a desire to constantly improve and adapt to new technologies

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with actuator design, motor selection and sizing
  • Materials science and metallurgy experience
  • Experience designing and fabricating with flexible materials
  • Complex surface modeling capabilities
  • Experience with kinematic motion analysis
  • Structural FEA experience
  • Experience with tolerance stack-up analysis
  • Sheet metal and weldment design
  • CAD administration, configuration, standards and roll-out experience
  • Matlab, Simulink or Python experience
  • Industrial design experience, ability to pair aesthetic form with function

Required Education

  • BS (MS preferred) or equivalent in mechanical engineering

Additional Information:

  • Help build and support small and large-scale interactive prototypes, mock-ups, and play-tests using a variety of industry-standard and Disney-proprietary software and hardware tools

  • Persuasively pitch compelling new experience concepts to project team and R&D leadership

  • Collaborate across diverse cross-functional teams, communicating clearly and with a positive and inclusive attitude

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proven ability to efficiently prototype new experiences, turning concepts into tangible artifacts that can be experienced and tested

  • Driven by the idea of creating new experiences for people, that our technological development is always in service of delivering magic to our guests

  • A broad understanding, comfort, and enthusiasm for technology and the ability to quickly and proactively learn new technologies, techniques, and tools

  • Mastery of design and productivity applications (e.g. Apple Keynote, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, Google Apps)

  • Experience writing code and/or scripting

  • Strong presentation skills and professional writing skills

  • Responsibility and flexibility. Excellent time management skills combined with the adaptability required in a dynamic and constantly changing innovation environment

  • Experience with hardware prototyping tools (e.g. Arduino, Raspberry Pi, microcontrollers, sensors, etc.)

  • Experience in 3D solid and/or surface modeling, rigging, or animation (e.g. Maya, SolidWorks, SketchUp)

  • Experience in the design and fabrication of physical objects, props, signage, or setwork (e.g. carpentry, 3D printing, solid/surface modeling, laser cutting, etc.)

  • Bachelor’s or Master's degree or comparable industry experience in a field related to creative technology applications (e.g. Industrial Design, Product Design, Media Arts, Animation, Experience Design, Entertainment Technology, etc.)

  • Additional engineering degree, minor, or coursework preferred (e.g. Computer Science Engineering, Human- Computer Interaction, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering)

Job Summary:

The WDI Apps team is an embedded product development team within the WDI Technology Studio. We are looking for Associate Product Managers to grow-with and support our various product domains. Associate PMs balance both product operations with product management. For operations, Associate PMs play an integral role in our go-to-market success, driving adoption, change management and creating a healthy product feedback loop. For product management, our Associate PMs will oversee product lanes of varying degrees within our large product initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in the research, definition, prioritization, and planning of Imagineer-facing software applications.

  • Drive communication, training, and documentation for product rollouts, updates and go-to-market success.

  • Analyze business processes, working with stakeholders to define workflows around software that we will buy or build.

  • Develop user and business metrics to evaluate success of applications, using measurements to inform product decisions.

  • Construct mockups or prototypes to test and communicate product direction.

  • Participate in purchasing, customizing, and integrating third-party systems and with existing applications internally.

  • Work with vendors and consultants in software development engagements.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Entry-level software product management acumen.

  • Direct or second-hand experience within the crossroads of entertainment and technology.

  • Strong communication skills: written, verbal, and presentational.

  • Strong passion for excellence in software development and product rigor.

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity and/or experience within a specific domain: content/media management, architecture and design, gaming, or mechanical engineering.

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, and/or business administration.

This role is considered on-site, which means the employee will work from a Company designated location on an ongoing basis.

About Walt Disney Imagineering:

Founded in 1952 as WED Enterprises to design and build the world’s first theme park — Disneyland — Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is where imagination and creativity combine with cutting-edge technology to create unforgettable experiences. WDI is the creative force that imagines, designs and builds all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Imagineering’s unique strength comes from its diverse global team of creative and technical professionals, who build on Disney’s legacy of storytelling to pioneer new forms of entertainment. The Imagineers who practice this unique blend of art and science work in more than 100 disciplines to shepherd an idea all the way from “blue sky” concept phase to opening day.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc., which is part of a business we call Walt Disney Imagineering.

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts U.S., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

  • Issue internal reports to Management and Stakeholders related to department spend and savings initiatives

  • Ability to interact with and establish relationships with employees and team members at all levels
  • Strong strategic agility
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to effectively report out findings
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Ability to collaborate in a team environment
  • Internal customer focus and excellent internal client support skills
  • Ability/desire to work in diverse and ever-changing environment
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity
  • Knowledge of Sourcing processes, basic legal terms and conditions, and entertainment industry trends and conditions
  • Experience in drafting and executing design, construction, service, and professional agreements as well as change orders.

  • Ability to work with and adapt to company systems, such as SAP and Ariba along with a proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Willingness to travel (position may require 5-10% travel)

  • Undergraduate degree in any above-mentioned related field/discipline

Preferred Education

  • Master’s degree in business or another quantitative discipline

Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research arm of The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) Parks and Resorts business segment. Representing more than 150 disciplines, the talented corps of Imagineers are responsible for the creation of Disney resorts, theme parks and attractions, hotels, water parks, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, cruise ships and new media technology projects.

The WDI Technology Studio is looking for talented software developers to create and deploy the next generation of show technologies that will drive our guest experiences in upcoming attractions and venues.

Responsibilities:

  • Estimation, design, implementation, peer review, testing, documentation, training, and turnover of all Show Control software artifacts pursuant to attraction and/or venue scope.
  • Task definition, organization, prioritization, scheduling, status tracking, and distribution of tasks among software project team members.
  • Must work closely with other technical divisions of work to ensure constructed systems (inclusive of both hardware and software) operate cooperatively and reliably over the expected usable life of project.
  • Must balance evolving technical requirements with fixed budgets and schedules, and communicate both risks and options to Studio, and Project leadership (as appropriate) in a timely fashion.
  • Partner with both Studio and Project leadership to execute project goals while employing best software development practices and adhering to relevant company and industry standards.
  • Work with other software project and product developers to provide incremental and overall updates to status and condition of software product progress.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years of Industrial Automation and/or Process Control experience, primarily focused on software development within the same domain
  • Knowledge and experience with modern software development practices, including version control and workflow management tools including JIRA, Clarity, Github, Gitlab, Subversion, Perforce, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Crucible, Jenkins, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience with process control/controls engineering industry standards, platforms/languages/technologies, including PLCs, FPGAs, embedded controllers/microcontrollers, RTOS programming environments, HMI and SCADA solutions.
  • Prior experience authoring and/or augmenting motion control software packages for Industrial or Entertainment focused applications.
  • Demonstrable technical writing, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Willing to travel on behalf of company to project destinations for the purposes of business trips (between overnight and 6 months stay), and also relocation (between 6 month and two year stay).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with: IEC61131-3 programming languages, EtherCAT, ADS, DS-402, Profibus, DMX/sACN, OPC-UA, MQTT, C#, Python, Java.
  • Familiarity and/or experience with: MS Visual Studio, RSLogix, Matlab, Robot OS (ROS), AutoDesk Maya, Motion Builder, AutoCAD
  • Experience with TwinCAT3 is a strong plus.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical engineering, computer engineering from accredited college or university. Advanced degrees preferred.

Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering makes the impossible possible, by combining innovation and storytelling to bring Disney stories, characters and worlds to life. Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects. Disney Imagineers are uniquely talented individuals that bring together the best aspects of creativity, innovation, and passion.

At Imagineering Research and Development, our mission is to use technology to build new experiences for our Guests and new tools for Imagineers and the Cast Members who power our parks. As R&D’s Business Manager, you will join a team of engineers, designers, artists and scientists who share a passion for solving hard problems. Your primary function is managing R&D department finances. You will be a trusted partner with R&D leadership, project teams, and WDI finance, working to deliver cutting edge technology planforms. You will also own key operations functions, using your analytical skills and creativity to enable innovation across the department.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage department finances, including budget tracking across all projects and operational costs

  • Provide strategic analysis of department spending, analyzing trends and providing insight into risks and opportunities

  • Develop qualitative and quantitative financial justifications for the development of new technology platforms

  • Attend project updates, becoming a trusted partner to R&D projects teams

  • Manage monthly reconciliation of forecasted project spending and reported actuals as well as fiscal year-end close out

  • Produce spreadsheets and documents to support yearly financial planning for both capital and P&L budgets

  • Manage all capital equipment requests and depreciation of assets

  • Assist project teams with make/buy analysis, partnering with team leads to strategize how to most effectively use available resources

  • Partner with the R&D productization program lead to build capital funding requests

  • Build strong relationships with WDI and DPEP finance and controllership

  • Own department resource planning

  • Manage the project pitch process and project close-out process, working with new project teams to articulate project work plans and ensuring that project complete final deliverables at completion

  • Manage space planning for the department, ensuring that all projects have the space they need to be successful

  • Functionally manage R&D support roles

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7+ year experience in a financial analysis or business management role

  • Strong excel skills and financial modeling experience

  • Thinks strategically, with demonstrated analytical decision-making skills

  • Proven ability to creatively solve challenges

  • Strong communication skills with a demonstrated ability to craft compelling and influential business justifications

  • Proactive, able to work in a flexible, fast-paced environment

  • Works collaboratively on diverse teams

  • Manages & prioritizes multiple assignments in a highly dynamic R&D environment

  • Has a passion for technology and delivering new tools, platforms and experiences

Required Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Finance, or related field

Preferred Education

MBA preferred

Founded in 1952 as WED Enterprises to design and build the world’s first theme park — Disneyland — Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is where imagination and creativity combine with cutting-edge technology to create unforgettable experiences. Imagineering’s unique strength comes from its diverse global team of creative and technical professionals, who build on Disney’s legacy of storytelling to pioneer new forms of entertainment. Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the creative force that imagines, designs and brings to life all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Working across a spectrum of disciplines that range from creative and conceptual to scientific and technical, Imagineers blend an innovative mixture of storytelling, art, science and technology to create immersive experiences, memorable destinations, and innovative entertainment for families around the globe.
We’re looking for professionals who are thirsty for diverse experiences, who are eager to learn and who are confident they can maintain the exacting standards for which The Walt Disney Company is known. If this sounds like you, we look forward to discussing the possibilities!
You already know what it means to be a Mechanical Engineer, but can you imagine using your skills at a place like Disney? You’d work to support all the theme parks, waterparks, golf courses, destination shopping districts, and resorts that are spread out across over 29,000 acres. This Imagineer is responsible for mechanical engineering including design, analysis, calculations, modeling and specifications for HVAC and plumbing systems; compressible fluid and cryogenic systems and central energy plants installations for the theme parks and resorts portfolio.

Responsibilities:

Every day as a Mechanical Engineer is different! On any given day, you might:
  • Provide Mechanical Engineering support to multiple stakeholders and partners across property as part of a larger team.
  • Under senior staff supervision, design, analyze, and provide mechanical engineering calculations for a single attraction of limited complexity
  • Provide construction administration support though site visits, shop drawing review, and sketch documentation under the direction senior staff supervision
  • Prepare designs and analyses in support of construction contract documentation
  • Ensure technical quality and conformance to department standards and procedures
  • Provide technical guidance to one or more mechanical designers in the production of construction contract documents
  • Provide root cause analysis with solution options, risks and recommendations to senior leadership
  • Function comfortably in a matrix organization, interfacing with outside vendors, local regulatory agencies, Disney leaders, and fellow cast members
  • Research and select systems/equipment that satisfies design parameters, all applicable codes and Disney standards

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Proficiency with Trace 700, eQUEST, IES-VE, or other energy modeling software
  • Understanding of fundamental plumbing systems (storm, sanitary, vent, water, and gas) is desired, along with proficiency in designing and sizing the plumbing systems
  • Advanced knowledge of the mechanical engineering discipline as it relates to facility design and construction, including campus piping network design, HVAC design and engineering, plumbing system sizing and design, construction methods and materials, and regulatory codes and standards.
  • Proficiency in current technology (Revit, Dynamo, Navisworks, AutoCAD) for the preparation and use of contract documents in all phases of design and construction administration
  • Familiarity with industrial design, including water treatment and process piping
  • Familiarity with industry HVAC and plumbing sustainability practices to reduce carbon footprint and improve facility efficiency
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience with developing BMS (Building Management System) control diagrams and sequence of operations is preferred
  • Experience performing life cycle analysis of various HVAC systems on the basis of energy use, first cost and life expectancy
  • Active membership in ASHRAE

Required Education

  • Graduate of an accredited engineering school with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Engineer-In-Training certification, if not already licensed as a professional engineer

Preferred Education

  • An advanced degree in the Mechanical Engineering field is desirable
  • We greatly value service in any of the US Armed Forces.

Job Summary:

Figure Show Programmers facilitate development of animation for Audio-Animatronics figures and animated props. They support the development of Audio-Animatronics figures through the building of animation rigs, as well as configure Audio-Animatronics figures and Show Action Equipment for safe operation. They work and collaborate closely with the Creative, Engineering, Ride, Manufacturing, Media Production, and Theme Park Maintenance teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Support a Figure Show Programming team through all phases of Engineering, Design, Production, Installation, Testing, and Documentation while partnering with the Animators and Creative Team to ensure the optimal creative performance and safety requirements of the Audio-Animatronics figures.
  • Involved in the rigging of characters for Audio-Animatronics figures, starting with concept development rigs all the way through the delivering of a final rig to animation, debugging broken or poorly functioning assets with minimal supervision.
  • Work closely with the Creative Teams (comprised of Animators, Visual Development, Modeling, Simulation, and look and scope development), iterating quickly and addressing notes accurately.
  • Partner with Engineering and Creative Teams to configure and program Audio-Animatronics figures and Show Action Equipment to conform to safety requirements and to meet creative intent.
  • Assist in creating, debugging, and organizing Audio-Animatronics digital assets (character sheets, animation data, rigs, ride paths, shots, and/or models).
  • Integrating Show Control systems with rides, Audio-Animatronics figures, and other show elements such as special effects, audio/video, projection, show lighting, etc.
  • Pipeline and Animation process support and asset integration.
  • Figure Programming process development support and ideation.
  • Document and archive all attraction show data created by the Show Programming department.
  • Tool development and maintenance.
  • Lead and mentor less experienced Show Programmers with the tools and skillset to grow within the department.
  • Assist Show Programming Management in casting and tool sets used across multiple projects.
  • Develop processes and pipeline with partnering groups to be used across projects.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Familiar with maintaining and creating rigs for CG character animation.
  • 5+ years experience in Feature Film, VFX, Television, Video Game, or Theme Park production.
  • Able to provide technical support for computer graphic animation applications.
  • Desired software knowledge/familiarity among: Maya and/or Motion Builder, Adobe Creative Suite, and Shotgun
  • Desired scripting knowledge with languages such as: Python and Mel
  • Able to communicate (verbally and in writing) clearly and concisely, regularly keeping stakeholders informed of status, risks, and issues.
  • Able to function in a dynamic work environment, managing multiple project activities.
  • Able to work with limited supervision and to integrate inputs from team members.
  • Have a high tolerance for change and changing requirements.
  • Be a creative problem solver and demonstrate comfort with inventive solutions.
  • Have a valid passport and willing to travel domestically or internationally.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Have basic knowledge of mechanical systems, control systems, and/or robotics.
  • Experience with Kuka robotics
  • Experience with motion-capture tools and processes
  • Familiarity with Unreal Engine and/or Unity, Z-Brush and Solidworks

Required Education

  • High School diploma.

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor's degree in Art, Illustration, Computer Graphics, Engineering, Game Development related field or equivalent experience
OR
  • Demonstrate multiple years of on-the-job experience and training in real-world industrial automation, or animation roles, as indicated above.

Perform Electronic Engineering activities related to attractions with electric motor controlled animated figures, animated props and show action equipment. Provide expertise in motion control systems, motor selection, motor drive design and selection and motor tuning using standard PID and advanced motion control techniques. Provide technical oversight to the project team members performing electronic engineering tasks: blue sky system definition, mock ups, theory of operation, circuit design, assembly design, system integration, facility sizing and supporting infrastructure, production, installation, and test and adjust. Enforce systems engineering process, discipline, and standards as well as ensuring a quality final product. Take responsibility for budget, schedule, and quality of attraction related deliverables.

Responsibilities:

  • Makes decisions and recommendations that are recognized as authoritative and have an important impact on extensive engineering activities as related to motion control systems hardware and software, specification, design, implementation, tuning and commissioning.
  • Reviews mechanical designs for control analysis, cabling paths, motor homing, electrical maintainability, and safety design.
  • Develops and maintains animated figure, animated prop, and show action equipment cabling designs, motor control architecture documentation, and a plan for animation tuning and commissioning.
  • Specifically tests and tunes individual motors for performance and creative intent while maintaining tuning parameters and any pertinent details to be documented for attraction turnover.
  • Frequently reviews industry standards and tracks development for recommendation of motors, motor drives, connectors, cables, sensors, and encoders.
  • Works with the software motion control team for control tool issues, changes, and features.
  • Troubleshooting of issues to help determine root cause and solution whether it be mechanical, software, or hardware related.
  • Initiates and maintains extensive contact with key engineers and officials of other organizations and companies, requiring skill in persuasion and negotiation of critical issues.
  • Demonstrate and practice creativity, foresight, and mature engineering judgment in anticipating and solving unprecedented engineering problems, program objectives and requirements, developing standards and guides for diverse engineering activities.
  • Ability to supervise an engineering team in the production of engineering designs, documentation for complex projects through all phases of engineering design, production, installation, testing, and documentation. Able to translate functional requirements into design requirements.
  • Must have knowledge of the procedures required to develop procurement specifications and design documents with emphasis on complex systems involving equipment, components, systems design and integration, procurement and installation.
  • Possess the skills necessary to execute the design of electrical and electronic systems and subsystems in accordance with accepted engineering practices, published codes and regulations, and science/physics as it relates to environmental, EMI/EMC considerations and constraints.

  • Ensure conformance to department standards and procedures.

  • Must be able to travel to all sites, as required, for periods of one to six weeks or more.

  • Support Show System operator and maintenance training.

  • Advanced Motion Control techniques (feed forward, gain scheduling, etc.)

Job Summary:

With an in-depth understanding of design intent and the ability to realize concepts through the execution of the creative process, the Lighting Designer, Sr. serves as a one of the creative leaders and representatives for Disney Live Entertainment's Lighting Design department at the Walt Disney World Resort. The Lighting Designer, Sr. develops Lighting Designs for new live shows, and facility infrastructures, and the remount of existing seasonal shows. A Senior-level Lighting Designer must demonstrate abilities in Lighting Design, while specializing in an area of expertise. You will be the accountable leader and subject matter expert for Laser Show/Systems Design.

You will report to the Principal Lighting Designer.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and execute Lighting Design projects, with a specialized focus on the design, installation, and sustainment of Laser Shows/Systems.
  • Participate in a project's creative development, culminating in the production of Lighting/Laser designs for live shows and facility infrastructure as assigned.
  • Lead the design of large-scale, long-term projects, with potential oversight of other team members.
  • Develop Lighting/Laser budgets, schedules, and labor requirements; maintain up-to-date show documentation; and partner with consultant Lighting Designers and vendors to ensure Disney quality, compatibility, training, and proper documentation of all Lighting services delivered.
  • Promote Company-wide standards and efficiencies; function as a mentor in the development of Technicians and Project Assistants/Planners; and exhibit the knowledge and ability to represent the Principal Designer and the department when called upon.
  • This Lighting Designer, Sr. position will also conduct ongoing Entertainment Show Quality evaluations of existing venues and offerings, providing support to sustain the original show design intent.
  • Be Laser subject matter expert and have extensive knowledge and experience designing and executing Laser Systems (including components, infrastructure, safety parameters, and controls requirements); and experience in the manufacturing of Laser Light Shows (including content creation, programming, testing, commissioning, and training of show operation procedures).
  • Understand and administer all applicable standards, and coordinate with internal partners (Laser Safety Officer, Technical Direction, Design Assurance, Show Control, multiple Engineers) to design these Laser Shows/Systems.
  • Engage the appropriate government authorities (FDA-CDRH and FAA) when facilitating the acquisition of new Laser Light Show variances, or the extension of existing ones, and manage the creation and revision of all documentation and processes required to satisfy and uphold compliance with federal regulations.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in the Entertainment Industry working in theatrical design, show development and operation of live shows/events
  • Experience with creative process and the development of a cohesive design, and ability to collaborate with other designers, directors, writers, and producers
  • Experience with current Lighting/Laser technology and industry standards for all aspects of Lighting/Laser Design (theatrical, industrial, concert, themed environment), as applied to live show and facility systems
  • Knowledge of Lighting/Laser Design theory and practice, especially as it applies to the creative process, and demonstrated experience in Lighting/Laser Design practice and procedures including show design, system/controls design, and content programming
  • Proven ability to deliver on a project's established scope, schedule, and budget
  • Natural inclination to produce ideas and the ability to do so with great fluency
  • Proven leadership abilities to make decisions, and work with a Master Electrician and Lighting/Laser Crew to prioritize, organize, instruct, and problem-solve during installation, focus, and cueing through delivery of project
  • Strong computer skills (Outlook, Excel, Word, AutoCAD, and industry specific software)
  • Ability to be flexible with work schedule, including nights, weekends, holidays, and travel

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in facility design, engineering, and construction
  • 2 years' experience in live show development with The Walt Disney Company
  • Knowledge of the Walt Disney heritage and culture
  • Willingness to travel domestically and internationally, and for extended periods of time
  • Bi-lingual or multi-lingual proficiency

Required Education

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Theater Technology and Design, with focus on live show Lighting/Lasers

Preferred Education

  • MFA in Theater Technology/Networking or Lighting Design or equivalent work experience

Additional Information:

Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of Disney’s Parks and Resorts business segment.   • Responsible for the complete design cycle of an Animated figure or show action element from mock up through design and production
  • Provide show system interface information to other groups within Imagineering
  • Author specifications and drive standards internal and external vendors
  • Provide installation support in the field (travel will be required at different times)
  • Author and perform test plans (QC,FAT, SAT)
  • Direct designers
  • Perform stress analysis and simulation
  • Manage vendors during production
  • Check design drawings
  • Provide manpower and scheduling input
  • Direct other engineers

  • 10 plus years with Disney engineering experience in robotic systems
  • Advanced simulation work in: vibration, skin systems, flexible bodies, FEA
  • Performs static and dynamic analysis
  • Finite Element Analysis
  • Proficiency in Solidworks 2018 or up
  • Proficiency in MATLAB
  • Proficiency in Ansys engineering simulation software
  • Strong understanding of Disney’s animation pipeline and processes
  • Team building and good communication skills
  • Strong vendor relationship skills
  • Advanced Drafting Skills
  • Advanced CAD skills in surface modeling organic shapes
  • Advanced Knowledge about mechanical components and selections
  • Advanced Knowledge of manufacturing processes. machining, 3D printing, pouring, welding,
  • Machine Design Skills
  • Fundamental knowledge of hydraulics and pneumatics systems
  • Project management skills- resource loading, scheduling, setting budgets.
  • Experienced with Design Management
  • Experienced managing outside consultants/vendors
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Function comfortably in a matrix organization

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong familiarity with Revit applications
  • Strong familiarity with Navisworks applications
  • Strong familiarity with Maya and animation applications for robotics systems
  • FOS or sustaining and or Park operations experience
  • Previous work experience or projects with Imagineering or Walt Disney R&D teams
  • Active member of related professional and technical societies
  • Strong familiarity with motion capture and targeting playback applications

Required Education

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from an accredited engineering school
  • An advanced degree in the mechanical engineering field is desirable

  • Masters in engineering management or systems engineering

description:
Job Summary:

"We create happiness.” That’s our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you’ll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!

Walt Disney Imagineering is the master planning, creative development, design, engineering, production, project management, and research and development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Its talented corps of Imagineers is responsible for the creation - from concept initiation through installation - of all Disney Resorts, theme parks and attractions, real estate developments, regional entertainment venues, and new media projects.

The sound editor/mixer position at Walt Disney Imagineering is a diverse and unique opportunity in the professional sound field. You will work with project teams and an Audio Media Designer (Sound Supervisor/Producer) to record, edit, mix and install the sound track for Disney attractions. You will need a strong post production sound background and experience with network audio as time will be split between studios in FL and on location mixing at Disney parks around the world.

Responsibilities:

Work with Audio Media Designer, Music Department and project team to support animatic stage production efforts.
  • Scratch track recording and editorial
  • Temp sound design and efficient picture conforms/changes.
  • Temp music editorial
  • Temp mixes for reviews and playbacks
Work with Audio Media Designer to support production and post production efforts on small and large-scale attractions.
  • Voiceover recording and editorial
  • ADR prep, recording and editorial
  • Sound design, effects editorial and sound effects recording
  • Attend live action shoots as Imagineering sound representative.
  • Production dialog editorial and cleanup
  • Manage large FX sessions from exterior sound design vendors
  • Manage large stem sessions from composer/music production team.
  • Assembly of scene mixes and track layouts per the Audio Media Designers track lists
  • Management of large track count conforms to picture updates
  • Custom I/O set up for non-standard output formats and field mix prep
Support Audio Media Designer and project team in performing final field mix
  • Work with A/V engineering to set up site-specific venue mix system. Have experience with network audio protocols, configurations, and troubleshooting (Dante, AES 67, etc.)
  • Perform field mix of music stems, sound FX units/pre dubs and dialog on attraction specific audio systems with custom routing and I/O. Work with Audio Media Designer, music department and project team to mix, address notes and install changes.
  • File installation, management, and revision control per sound department SOP
  • Burn final media and QC complete show.
  • Archive projects according to sound department SOP
Addition responsibilities include:
  • Master of background music
  • Transfer of historical archive to current technology
  • Studio trouble shooting/maintenance
  • Recording vocals, overdubs or other small-scale music session for the music depart.
  • Travel to domestic and foreign venues for extended periods of time

Basic Qualifications:

  • 5 or more years of experience in post-production audio
  • Proficiency in sound production and post-production equipment including: Protools, digital consoles and controllers.
  • Understanding of network audio.
  • Ability to learn proprietary digital formats (Mac and PC based) with minimum instruction
  • Experience with SMPTE, different frame rates, and video formats and how to sync them together.
  • Work Independently in patching, digital routing, equipment operation, signal flow and technical operations
  • Trouble shoot technical problems with mixing equipment, computers, and network.
  • Work with new technology with a minimum of instruction
  • Create new techniques, especially in special venue mixing, including taking tracks on location, setting up temporary, full-service production environments and performing a mix in the final venue.
  • Strong collaborator and team player.
  • Experience working in immersive environments
  • Understanding of acoustics and how it effects audio delivery and intelligibility
  • Flexibility to work on multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize workload.
  • Must be willing to mix and work in challenging environments.

Required Education

High school Diploma or Equivalent

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

We ask that you are equal parts organizational thinker, tactician, process expert and empath, able to create order and trust in diverse teams spanning creative, business, strategy and investment partners within and beyond the Company. This role also serves as co-administrators of the New Experience process and review meetings to support DPEP Chairperson and additional DPEP Executive Committee level leaders, helping establish and lead agendas, ensure review of plans and harness direction and decisions from the highest levels of leadership. This role is an important team role to partner across all WDI studios, Global Business Development and a wide network of partners and collaborates to ensure everyone has a singular, integrated plan of action and shared view of success. You will oversee the portfolio of new experiences work, understanding and mastery of the process needs, interpersonal dynamics and tactical planning required for high-functioning teams to establish trust and achieve work results. This is an ideal role for a motivated talent, passionate about team building, process mapping and sharing in success in the earliest, most creative phases of ideation and business thinking.

You will report to the Portfolio Creative Executive New Experiences Development.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with important members across all resources in planning and process management across the entirety of New Experiences initiatives and efforts globally
  • Manage internal review pace with New Experience team and project efforts, including prioritization of time, resources, agendas and decisions
  • Lead communication across horizontal and vertical teams with a focus on aggregation of holistic strategic approach and individual agreement
  • Promote processes that ensure the most efficient use of resources to meet project delivery timelines
  • Manage all relationships to ensure highest output of quality results while keeping focus on building momentum
  • Summarize planning strategies for presentation and guide timeline integration of New Experience initiatives
  • Advise leadership on team dynamics and areas for greater understanding and agreement of shared success
  • Manage a wide network of trusted partners, collaborators, administrative and technical experts required for smooth execution of work plans, team meetings and leadership reviews
  • Oversee the operations of shared team space, including assignment of space and technology systems
  • Partner and delegate calendar management and prioritization to executive administrative support for the team and new experiences leadership
  • Manage regular consolidation of progress reporting of New Experiences efforts for senior leadership
  • Communicate talent and resource planning inputs to studio and department leaders and partners on behalf of New Experiences programs

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 7 years relevant experience in a planning, organizational development or chief of staff-level position
  • Understanding of strategic planning, forecasting and budget management at a project level
  • Expert navigator of interpersonal and team dynamics, communication and issue resolution
  • Knowledge of business strategies to influence and lead New Experience programs
  • Expert navigator of complex dynamics and how to translate for best team success
  • Collaborate, influence, and develop/maintain relationships at all levels, with experience and knowledgeable at senior most levels of leadership
  • Understanding of the integration of multiple data sources into clear, relevant insights that build concrete solutions
  • Experience with the creative process and needs of teams at the earliest phases of new ideas
  • Prioritize work and lead high-level output accomplishing tasks at a tactical level and work through conflicting/changing priorities

Required Education

  • BS/BA in finance, business, design or engineering

Preferred Education

  • MBA

Job Summary:

Do you have deep experience supporting high-level executives? Are you known for keeping your cool under pressure? Can you interact with the most senior levels of management? If you’re nodding your head, then an Executive Support Professional position in Walt Disney Imagineering’s Global Franchise & Partnership Development Studio and Story Development Studio might be right for you..

Our Executive Support Professionals are highly-respected because their skills are quite simply, essential. You’d be a key member of a dynamic, fast-paced team that creates the music throughout our global theme parks, attractions, and resorts, and would work with some of the most creative, intelligent people in the business. Join us – apply today!

This position currently reports to WDI’s VP Global Franchise & Partnership Development and Executive Story Development.

Responsibilities:

These teams are responsible for the integration of TWDC Franchises (i.e. Marvel & Lucas) into Park experiences along with the integration of third party partners into our parks globally. Additionally, this team leads the story development needs of all park experiences globally as well as framing up and developing IP for TWDC content teams. This is a unique opportunity for anyone looking to further develop their skills in a fun, fast moving dynamic environment. This joint team is closely aligned with many studio, tv, Disney+ partners so experience in that world is ideal. It goes without saying that there will be expense reports, travel planning, and heavy calendar jockeying, but this job is very much about people. The relationship you form with the executives you support is absolutely critical, because that’s what enables you to become a true partner. In addition to understanding your executives business -- and business needs -- inside and out, you’ll also need to develop deep knowledge of the leadership and workings of WDI and of related departments across the Disney enterprise. As the “face” of your executives within The Walt Disney Company, your professionalism, loyalty and attitude are a reflection of the office, and as such, are a key component to its success. Every day as an Executive Support Professional is different! On any given day you might:
  • Manage a very busy calendar on behalf of your executive. You’ll work with colleagues across TWDC and Imagineering, as well as with many different Disney executives across Studios, Disney+, Consumer Products and external production companies;
  • Assist with other Franchise, Partnership and Story Team members with various administrative, departmental and office needs;
  • Conduct research, fact-check existing work, and prepare agendas and summaries pending the meeting needs. You’ll have tasks that you “own” completely and will provide regular assistance on others;
  • Create global, multi-city travel itineraries, taking into account time zones, weather delays, traffic and fatigue levels;
  • Interface directly with other senior executives and their support teams – your ability to work well with people on all levels is a very important part of your job;
  • Review your leader’s schedule to build-in time for things like thinking and traveling to their next meeting or be mindful of the different timezones partners are working in;
  • Understand the day’s priorities so you can be strategic about how you direct phone calls and set meetings;
  • Schedule conference rooms, meetings and zoom chats;
  • Be ready to throw the entire schedule out the door when an emergency comes up, then pick it up again when the dust settles;
  • Handle extremely confidential, sensitive information, remembering that Disney is a publicly traded company;
  • Draft letters and emails on behalf of your leaders;
  • Assist with on-boarding new employees – you’ll be the “friendly face” that newbies count on to answer all their questions, including some who are extremely senior in the organization;
  • Manage large purchase orders and vendor contracts or any office supply needs;
  • Mentor and train other support professionals in hard skills like computer programs, and soft skills like teamwork; and
  • Plan your executive involvement in large, high-profile events like premiers, product launches, off-sites and team-building activities.

Basic Qualifications:

Here’s what you will need to be successful in this role:
  • Sharp written and verbal communication skills, including flawless grammar and a rich vocabulary;
  • Desire to immerse yourself fully and learn all aspects of your executive’s business;
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize deadlines/deliverables;
  • Strong proficiency with all types of computers, phones and office equipment, as well as mastery of Microsoft Office programs, SAP, Confluence, Concur, and working in a Windows environment;
  • A calm head and steady hand to deal with the unexpected;
  • “EQ” skills to build bridges, forge alliances and encourage people to want to work with you;
  • Complete reliability handling confidential, often highly sensitive information;
  • Desire to truly be helpful to your leaders and co-workers, to go the extra mile without being asked. Resourcefulness is key;
  • Some flexibility in your schedule – we value work/life balance, but in a pinch, a bit more time is needed;
  • Very strong organizational skills and extreme attention to detail;
  • A highly professional demeanor, positive outlook and a can-do attitude; and
  • Strong professionalism and discretion.

Preferred Qualifications:

It would be great if you also had these skills:
  • At least 5 years supporting an executive and/or equivalent experience;
  • Experience at The Walt Disney Company;
  • Experience working in a large public corporation;
  • Experience working with Creative teams and executives;
  • Familiarity and experience working with TV & film related teams; and
  • Excellent knowledge of MAC computers and software such as Keynote.

High school diploma or equivalent

Preferred Education

Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience
