Job Summary:

Reporting to the Manager, Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) Communications, the Communications Manager – Project Hire (PH) develops comprehensive project plans that maximize reputation value for our company and support the marketing/PR strategies that drive the business. This role partners heavily with communications professionals across the company to proactively identify opportunities and integrate tactics into various plans while also managing incoming requests. As a key part of the project team, the Communications Manager (PH) also manages media production, asset creation and event support, in addition to Imagineer preparation and staffing needs. Developing messaging, identifying potential risks and mitigation measures are also part of the job responsibilities, and on all projects, the Communications Manager (PH) works closely with executives on a variety of reviews and approvals.

Responsibilities:

Every day as a Communications Manager is different, but in any given day YOU might:
  • Serve as primary contact for WDI partners for assigned capital projects
  • Responsible for evaluating feasibility and prioritizatizing opportunities
  • Provide editorial direction with input from WDI executives as needed
  • Develop story ideas and write for multiple communication avenues including project communication plans, fact sheets, web and social media content, video news releases and podcasts
  • On-site support, coordination and oversight during filming/photography
  • Serve as an advocate for WDI’s position and surface potential conflicts with WDI Communications leadership and management early in the process
  • Interface with project executives and WDI legal department to ensure all WDI approvals are obtained prior to publishing/posting/releasing content
  • Partner with Marketing Strategy and Public Relations to identify new media opportunities to showcase Imagineers and the work they do

  • Develop new media content showcasing WDI and DPEP strategies; leverage social media content creators whenever appropriate
  • Strengthen relations with third party media and industry partners
  • Leverage media opportunities across functions and businesses to bolster reputation across The Walt Disney Company and Disney Parks, Experiences and Products
  • Manage speaking engagements and public appearances for Imagineers (presentations, speeches, meet & greets, book/DVD/art signings, etc.)
  • Direct and manage photography, video, collateral and related requests from various partners, communications departments to be used for internal and external initiatives
  • Support ongoing WDI communications and events, as needed

Basic Qualifications:

Please apply if YOU have:
  • 3 - 5 years of communications or public affairs experience working with global brands
  • Strong project management skills
  • Excellent oral/written communication and presentation skills
  • Solid business acumen
  • Demonstrated creative thinking and the ability to take initiative with projects and anticipate issues of concern
  • Ability to work independently, to take initiative, and to function effectively in a team environment

Preferred Qualifications:

It would be great if YOU also had:
  • Technical acumen, and an interest in/understanding of tech and innovation
  • Understanding of graphic design and video editing programs
  • Bilingual (any language is a plus)

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent work experience

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at disneycareers.com/benefits
Please add in the Additional Information Section: It is highly encouraged to add a link to your portfolio or writing samples in your resume

description:
Job Summary:

Walt Disney Imagineering is the creative force that imagines, designs and brings to life all Disney theme parks, resorts, attractions and cruise ships worldwide. Working across a spectrum of disciplines that range from creative and conceptual to scientific and technical, Imagineers blend an innovative mixture of storytelling, art, science and technology to create immersive experiences, memorable destinations, and innovative entertainment for families around the globe.

We’re looking for professionals who are thirsty for diverse experiences, who are eager to learn and who are confident they can maintain the exacting standards for which The Walt Disney Company is known. If this sounds like you, we look forward to discussing the possibilities!

The Associate Project Engineer oversees the technical coordination and integration of the Environmental Design and Engineering (ED&E) disciplines during the course of specific projects, lands, resorts or parks including coordination of ED&E efforts across various disciplines.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist Project Engineers or Design Managers in the architecture and facilities engineering project coordination and integration from conceptual design through construction and re-imagining of resorts and themed entertainment projects.
  • Help facilitate technical coordination of A/E design documents, models, specs, basis of design among Environmental Design & Engineering (ED&E) design disciplines and across WDI Divisions (Show, Ride, Creative), and in consideration of programmatic requirements (Operational Partners).
  • Help coordinate the document release process between disciplines and document control specialist (plot coordination, repro and digital/physical distribution).
  • Help organize and facilitate big room/ICE (Integrated Concurrent Engineering) sessions, design reviews.
  • Help with quality assurance and control, both of design documentation and field construction.
  • Help resolve questions arising from construction documents, field conditions and contractor requests for information.
  • Track facility punch lists.
  • Coordinate document release process between disciplines and document control specialist (plot coordination, repro and digital/physical distribution).
  • Provide technical input to other project team members to assist with project decision-making and settling of contractor change orders.
  • Resolve questions arising from construction documents, field conditions and contractor requests for information.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum 1 year of experience.
  • Working knowledge of Building Information Management (BIM).
  • Knowledgeable in the use of computer technology in the CADD generation of drawings.
  • Communicate with the project team, including the discipline leads or main department representatives.
  • Solicit support from the design manager and department head to resolve issues.
  • Knowledge in the use of Revit.

Required Education

  • Graduate of an accredited school of engineering or architecture with a Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree.

Preferred Education

  • Advanced degree desired but not required.

Additional Information:

Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.
